p:
Qinghai-Tibetan Plateau is the largest plateau with the highest average altitude on the planet. It is also the most sensitive area on Earth
1 . In addition, it is highly influenced by the East Asian monsoon, the Indian monsoon, and the Westerly
2– 4 . Qinghai Lake (N36.51°–37.25°; E99.58°–100.79°) is located in northeastern Qinghai-Tibetan Plateau, and it is the largest lake in China (see Fig. 1). It is a salt lake with the lake area of ~4300 km 2. The lake is surrounded by Qilian Mountains, AltynTagh Mountains, and the Kunlun Mountains. Gangshika peak (N101.51°, E37.69°, 5254.5 m) of Qilian Mountains is ~120 km away from Qinghai Lake, which is the peak nearest to Qinghai Lake with altitude >5000 m.
